title: [Fix](executor)Fix scan entity core
body:
## Proposed changes
When set enable_workload_group_for_scan = true, it could happens.

## Why core?
After the last time to call scan_task.scan_func()ï¼Œthe should be ended, this means PipelineFragmentContext could be released.
Then after PipelineFragmentContext is released, visiting its  field such as query_ctx or _state may cause core dump.
But it can only explain core 2
```
void ScannerScheduler::_task_group_scanner_scan(ScannerScheduler* scheduler,
                                                taskgroup::ScanTaskTaskGroupQueue* scan_queue) {
    while (!_is_closed) {
        taskgroup::ScanTask scan_task;
        auto success = scan_queue->take(&scan_task);
        if (success) {
            int64_t time_spent = 0;
            {
                SCOPED_RAW_TIMER(&time_spent);
                scan_task.scan_func();
            }
            scan_queue->update_statistics(scan_task, time_spent);
        }
    }
}
```

title: [fix](function) fix create tablet timeout
body:
## Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

<!--Describe your changes.-->

To get tablet's local size and remote size both need lock the tablet's meta.  

Sometimes the meta lock was locked by other process for a  long time (eg, publish version).

It will cause function 'get root path info' hold the tablet manager's shard lock for a long time too.

Then it will cause creating tablet could not get the shard lock and  finally timeout.

Let geting tablet's local size/size  go out of the scope of tablet manager shard lock.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [improvement](planner) Enable preagg when count distinct key
body:
## Proposed changes
A table like this:
```
create table xxx (key1, key2, key3)  AGGREGATE KEY(key, key1, key2, key3)
with rollup r_test (key1, key2,key3)

```
Now, ```select key1, count(distinct key2), count(disinct key3) from table xxx group by key1``` can not use rollup `r_test`.

Issue Number: close #xxx

<!--Describe your changes.-->

title: [Fix](parquet-reader) Fix parquet string column min max statistics issue which caused query result incorrectly.
body:
## Proposed changes
In parquet, min and max statistics may not be able to handle UTF8 correctly. 
Current processing method is using min_value and max_value statistics introduced by PARQUET-1025 if they are used.
If not, current processing method is temporarily ignored. A better way is try to read min and max statistics if it contains only ASCII characters. I will improve it in the future PR.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [Fix](pipeline) Close sink during fragment context destruction
body:
## Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

This PR introduces the following changes:

1. Explicitly close the sink of `_pipeline_map` during the destructor of `FragmentMgr`. This is necessary to ensure that all resources are properly cleaned up.
2. The need for this change arises from the fact that `VOlapTableSink::_send_batch_process` is a background thread that needs to be closed before the destructor is called. Failing to do so could potentially lead to memory leaks or other issues.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [Fix](Planner) fix limit execute before sort in show export job
body:
## Proposed changes

Problem: 
When doing show export jobs, limit would execute before sort before changed. So the result would not be expected because limit always cut results first and we can not get what we want.
Example:
we having export job1 and job2 with JobId1 > JobId2. We want to get job with JobId1
show export from db order by JobId desc limit 1;
We do limit 1 first, so we would probably get Job2 because JobId assigned from small to large
Solve: 
We can not cut results first if we have order by clause. And cut result set after sorting

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [Feature](doris compose) A tool for setup and manage doris docker cluster scaling easily
body:
## Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

<!--Describe your changes.-->

Add a tool to setup and manager doris compose cluster.

```
usage: doris-compose.py [-h] {up,down,ls,start,stop,restart,pause,unpause} ...

positional arguments:
  {up,down,ls,start,stop,restart,pause,unpause}
    up                  Create and upgrade doris containers. If none of --add-fe-num, --add-be-num, --fe-id, --be-id is specific, apply to all containers.
    down                Down doris containers, networks. It will also remove node from DB. If none of --fe-id, --be-id is specific, then apply to all containers.
    ls                  List running doris compose clusters.
    start               Start the doris containers. If none of --fe-id, --be-id is specific, then apply to all containers.
    stop                Stop the doris containers. If none of --fe-id, --be-id is specific, then apply to all containers.
    restart             Restart the doris containers. If none of --fe-id, --be-id is specific, then apply to all containers.
    pause               Pause the doris containers. If none of --fe-id, --be-id is specific, then apply to all containers.
    unpause             Unpause the doris containers. If none of --fe-id, --be-id is specific, then apply to all containers.

options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
```

For more usage,  run 
```
python docker/runtime/doris-compose/doris-compose.py 
```
## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [Feature](datatype) Add IPv4/v6 data type for doris
body:
## Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #21370

## Describe your changes
Now We do not support IPv4/v6 data type for doris witch is common data type in database
So it's the time to support it ! We have some basic funnctions for data type to check the data type is supported completly

- [x] support CURD

 - [x] support StreamLoad

 - [x] support Serde functions

 - [x] support (implicit/explicit) cast functions. The following cast functions have been implementedï¼š
1. uint8/int8 -> ipv4
2. uint16/int16 -> ipv4
3. uint32/int32 -> ipv4
4. uint64/int64 -> ipv4
5. string -> ipv4
6. string -> ipv6


- [x] specific functions for itself data type (u can reference clickhouse or mysql). The following functions have been implementedï¼š
1. ipv4numtostring(n)
2. ipv4stringtonum(s)
3. ipv4stringtonum_or_null(s)
4. ipv4stringtonum_or_default(s)
5. inet_ntoa(n)
6. inet_aton(s)
7. isipv4string(s)
8. ipv6numtostring(n)
9. ipv6stringtonum(s)
10. ipv6stringtonum_or_null(s)
11. ipv6stringtonum_or_default(s)
12. inet6_ntoa(n)
13. inet6_aton(s)
14. isipv6string(s)

 - [x] make a Performance Test result with clickhouse or ElasticSearch in load this data type
test case:

A CSV file containing three columns(id int, ip_v4 ipv4, ip_v6 ipv6), with a file size of 400MB.

**Doris: 27.861s**
DDL SQL as follows: 
```SQL
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS ip_stream_load (
  `id` int,
  `ip_v4` ipv4,
  `ip_v6` ipv6
) ENGINE=OLAP
DISTRIBUTED BY HASH(`id`) BUCKETS 4
PROPERTIES (
"replication_allocation" = "tag.location.default: 1"
);
```
**ClickHouse: 1s**
DDL SQL as follows: 
```SQL
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS ip_stream_load (
    id Int32,
    ip_v4 IPv4,
    ip_v6 IPv6
) ENGINE = MergeTree()
ORDER BY id;
```

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [refactor](load) cleanup segment flush logic in beta rowset writer
body:
## Proposed changes

1. Cleanup segment writer creation logic and segment flush logic in beta rowset writer.
2. Remove `FlushContext`, and pass `segment_id`, `no_compression`, `flush_schema` explicitly.
3. Fix a bug when `NO_COMPRESSION` should not be used when adding many small blocks by `add_block()`.
4. Allocate real segment id in `allocate_segment_id()`, instead of offset against `_segment_start_id`.
5. Blocks for mow partial update (calc_segment_delete_bitmap) will be flushed into one segment per block.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [enhancement](Nereids) check multiple distinct  functions that cannot be transformed into muti_distinct
body:
## Proposed changes

This commit introduces a transformation for SQL queries that contain multiple distinct aggregate functions. When the number of distinct values processed by these functions is greater than 1, they are converted into multi_distinct functions for more efficient handling.

Example:
```
SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT c1), SUM(DISTINCT c2) FROM tbl GROUP BY c3
-- Transformed to
SELECT MULTI_DISTINCT_COUNT(c1), MULTI_DISTINCT_SUM(c2) FROM tbl GROUP BY c3
```

The following functions can be transformed:
- COUNT
- SUM
- AVG
- GROUP_CONCAT

If any unsupported functions are encountered, an error is now reported during the optimization phase.

To ensure the absence of such cases, a final check has been implemented after the rewriting phase.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [fix](multi-table-load) fix memory leak when processing multi-table routine load
body:
## Proposed changes

close:#21606
 
### Debug

Using jemalloc prof tool and found there is unreasonable memory overhead within multi_table_put_result obj.
![image](https://github.com/apache/doris/assets/82279870/1eb53a3f-146b-460e-9400-e79f19191af2)

Found that there are cycle refs during processing each single routine load task, i.e. StreamLoadContext holds a shared ptr ref to MultiTablePipe, and MultitablePipe holds shared ptr ref to StreamLoadContext as well.

Furthermore, during related loading process, StreamLoadContext's obj cnt is always growing and do not decrease when load stream stopped.
![image](https://github.com/apache/doris/assets/82279870/aa4db539-297c-4e34-8803-f4293a09da00)

### Resolve

Using a naked ptr rather than shared ptr in MultiTablePipe to hold the StreamLoadContext, so that both the StreamLoadContext and the MultiTablePipe will be released normally. 

Why not use weak_ptr?
1. Cuz introducing weak_ptr is not so elegant and has lower performance.
2. MultiTablePipe's life cycle is under control of the StreamLoadContext, it is reasonable to use raw ptr to provide MultiTablePipe with an access to the current ctx. StreanLoadContext is sure to be released after MultiTablePipe, and will not result in dangling pointer. 

### Fix result

Memory usage during load process:
![image](https://github.com/apache/doris/assets/82279870/e2980411-91aa-4cb4-aecc-db5685ac79e9)


Observing the obj cnt:
![image](https://github.com/apache/doris/assets/82279870/0b0062b6-39b5-42f6-ab02-439762afdb59)

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

Issue Number: close #xxx

This PR aims to address the need for resetting the InvertedIndexSearcherCache during the destroy of doris_be. Given that InvertedIndexSearcherCache is a global instance, it is necessary to explicitly reset its members.

Implementing this change will effectively eliminate the memory leak information that currently appears when doris_be is stopped gracefully. This contributes to a cleaner and more efficient shutdown process.

title: [fix](tablet report) fix fe can not update replica's status with be's report
body:
## Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

<!--Describe your changes.-->

FE should update its replica's version and health status(is bad or not),  if its state is fall behind BE.

For example,  if BE take away the disk or disk is not available now,  then BE will report lost replica and FE will mark this replica as bad.  

Next BE reinstall the disk and disk is now available, then it will report its replica is ok,  then FE should mark this replica as good.

title: [fix](catalog) wrong required slot info causing BE crash
body:
## Proposed changes

For file scan node, this is a special field `requiredSlot`, this field is set depends on the `isMaterialized` info of slot.
But `isMaterialized` info can be changed during the plan process, so we must update the `requiredSlot`
in `finalize` phase of scan node, otherwise, it may causing BE crash due to mismatching slot info.
